metadata.title: CVE-2024-28054 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Amavis before 2.12.3 and 2.13.x before 2.13.1, in part because of its useof MIME-tools, has an Interpretation Conflict (relative to some mail useragents) when there are multiple boundary parameters in a MIME emailmessage. Consequently, there can be an incorrect check for banned files ormalware.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-28054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

amavisd-new - 1:2.11.0-6.1ubuntu1.1
amavisd-new-postfix - 1:2.11.0-6.1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: amavisd-new package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11.0-6.1ubuntu1.1').
